intro: Fissipetalum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean fissipetalum, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
